stages.heading: Stardate 2400.0 (Introduction)
stages.commentary:
Welcome to Alien Empires. With plenty of playthroughs under our belt, we have decided a rematch with Hard difficulty was in order, only we are doing this on the Regular map.

We will also take advantage of the Close Encounters supplementary gimmicks that are available to the Regular and Large-sized Alien Empires maps. Experience, boarding ships, security forces, ground units, and titans are fair game to both sides. Alien Technology is available exclusively to the human player, if they choose to buy one for 10 CP each time they first colonize a barren planet. The human player can also choose to start with 1 Flagship, but with only the default equipment. Since this is still a non-VP scenario, all other mechanics work as similiarly to vanilla Alien Empires as possible.

stages.heading: Stardate 2400.3 (Turn 1)
stages.commentary: Well... it is not every day our first turn uncovers only minerals.

stages.heading: Stardate 2400.6 (Turn 2)
stages.commentary: This scenario is giving us How not to play vibes with the mineral distribution. We have found absolutely no planets to colonize this economic phase!

stages.heading: Stardate 2400.9 (Turn 3)
stages.commentary: We finally found a planet, but not early enough to spend one of our Colony Ships.

stages.heading: Stardate 2401.0 (Economic Phase 1)
stages.commentary:
What a disasterious opening. With no colonies under our banner this first economic phase, our growth has been slowed. It is fortunate that Close Encounters gives us an increased starting income, but the Alien Players get extra toys, too. Anyway, we will buy Exploration 1 (-15), followed by one Colony Ship (-8).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Among the extra toys they get, an expansion fleet bank is not one of them. Still, Hard difficulty gives Alien Players 10 CP per economic roll. Thus, they rolled 4 (Trinculo) / 6 (Umbriel). Since this is the first phase, they will not launch fleets even if they somehow had the CP to do so.

stages.heading: Stardate 2401.2 (Turn 4)
stages.commentary: Considering where our luck went on the first economic phase, it would have only been a matter of time before the rest of the planets showed themselves. We also upgrade our Flagship while at it, spending 3 CP in the process.

stages.heading: Stardate 2401.5 (Turn 5)
stages.commentary: The upgrade makes it easier and safer to explore new ground; if our Flagship uncovers a black hole remotely, we can avoid it safely.

stages.heading: Stardate 2401.8 (Turn 6)
stages.commentary: Risky, but this turn works great. One of our scouts uncovered our home system black hole. We rolled a 2, escaping its gravitational pull.

stages.heading: Stardate 2402.0 (Economic Phase 2)
stages.commentary:
Our income can start growing at last. Since we found our first barren planet, we buy Terraforming 1 (-20), followed by 2 more colony ships (-16).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Now the Alien Players get their chance. With just 1 economic roll available each still, they rolled 5 (Trinculo) / 8 (Umbriel). Neither player has any appropriate CP to launch a fleet, so that ends this phase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2402.1 (Turn 7)
stages.commentary: With the risk of uncovering the rest of our home system eliminated, we take advantage of our Flagship's dual purpose system, and uncovered our first deep space barren planet. As with vanilla Alien Empires, there are no non-player aliens present.

stages.heading: Stardate 2402.4 (Turn 8)
stages.commentary: We uncover our first danger markers of the playthrough! One of them claims our one of our Scouts, while the second one was negated via Flagship Exploration.

stages.heading: Stardate 2402.7 (Turn 9)
stages.commentary: Now that our home systems are all uncovered, our Flagship will be using a slower, but safer, strategy towards the nearest Alien Player homeworld.

stages.heading: Stardate 2403.0 (Economic Phase 3)
stages.commentary:
Recent deep space losses slightly decrease our maintenance. Since we colonized our first deep space planet, we will draw two alien technology cards. We can choose between Combat Sensors and Efficient Factories. We will choose the latter (-10). We then buy 4 scouts (-24).

{prodTable}{techTable}

The Alien Players each gained a second natural economic rolls. They rolled 6,7 (Trinculo) / 2,7 (Umbriel). Umbriel has enough CP to launch a fresh fleet, and will do so automatically. They then roll a 9 on the Movement step (skip).

stages.heading: Stardate 2403.3 (Turn 10)
stages.commentary: Now that Umbriel has their first fleet on the board, things have become a little dicier.

stages.heading: Stardate 2403.6 (Turn 11)
stages.commentary:
Our second scout has gotten lost in space. It was involuntarily sent to another unexplored hex.

The Battle for Sector I11

Meanwhile, their fleet has come to greet our Flagship. Since we are playing with Close Encounters rules, we build this non-raider fleet as if it was an expansion fleet.

  1. Preparation: Since no priority technologies are needed, Umbriel goes straight to the Ship Size step, which is automatically bought (-10)
  2. A roll of 1/8 then causes Military Academy 1 to be bought (-10)
  3. The only remaining technology affordable is Minesweeping 1 (-10), which spends their entire technology bank
  4. On the construction ship, a Destroyer is the largest ship they can afford (-9), which spends almost all their assigned CP
  5. They also get a free Transport, filled with 6 Light Infantry

  6. Round 1: Umbriel has the Fleet Size Bonus for this round. Additionally, all experience is equal this battle
  7. Still, asteroid belt interference is virtually meaningless when we have the tactics advantage. We will focus down their Destroyer, rolling a 6 (miss >4)
  8. Umbriel's ships respond with 9/1 (1 hit ≤4/1), damaging our ship to 2 HP

  9. Round 2: Our Flagship rolls a 4 (hit ≤4). A 5 is then rolled for experience (failure >2)
  10. With Fleet Size Bonus no longer meaningful, Umbriel's Transport responds with a 3 (miss >1)

  11. Round 3: Our Flagship now rolls a 1 (hit ≤3), finishing off Umbriel's first fleet. A 3 is then rolled for experience (failure >2)

stages.heading: Stardate 2403.9 (Turn 12)
stages.commentary: Even with the extra CP granted by Hard difficulty, Umbriel's first fleet was pathetically small. Still, they will be able to snowball more easily as time passes. We manage to fully expose a path to each Alien Player homeworld; at the expense of losing a second Scout to the dangers of deep space.

stages.heading: Stardate 2404.0 (Economic Phase 4)
stages.commentary:
Our first battle success makes it easier to keep on applying the pressure against the Alien Players. Anyway, we open our options for future phases by buying Ship Yards 2 (-20), followed by 4 more Scouts (-24).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Alien Player economics expanded to include the Defense bank. Their economic rolls are 5,7 (Trinculo) / 5,9 (Umbriel). Both players are eligible for fleet launch, but this is no longer an automatic process. Still, they rolled 5 (Trinculo) / 10 (Umbriel). The former launches a fleet anyway, and now rolls a 10 on the Movement step (skip).

stages.heading: Stardate 2404.2
stages.commentary: We have found a warp point. Since they are not explicitly prohibited, we will allow their use for this playthrough. Still, useless by itself.

stages.heading: Stardate 2404.5
stages.commentary: Not much special this time; we found another barren planet.

stages.heading: Stardate 2404.8
stages.commentary: Staging a potential assault soon, depending on Umbriel's next economic rolls.

stages.heading: Stardate 2405.0
stages.commentary:
Now that we have a few colonies at full strength, our Efficient Factories are kicking in for +3 extra CP, on top of the income we would already have. We then buy 2 Scouts (-12) + 4 Colony Ships (-32) at our homeworld, and a pair of forward colonies are also gaining Ship Yards (-12). One of our colonies also gained a free Light Infantry.

{prodTable}{techTable}

Alien Players now get their chance. They rolled 4,8 (Trinculo) / 1,5 (Umbriel). Umbriel's extra economic roll will take place on economic phase 8. They both are still eligible for fleet launch, and rolled 1 (Trinculo) / 6 (Umbriel). Trinculo launches another fleet, and rolls a 10 on the Movement step (skip).

stages.heading: Stardate 2405.1
stages.commentary: What a meaningless warp point. We will remove it from this map.

stages.heading: Stardate 2405.4
stages.commentary: Since it is unsafe to bring our Flagship against a homeworld without minesweepers, we will instead take it west to assist with interception.

stages.heading: Stardate 2405.7
stages.commentary:
Not entirely meaningless, but still... the clump of warp points hurt their utility. Meanwhile, it is time to intercept Trinculo's first fleet.

  1. Preparation: As usual, we skip to the Ship Size step. Trinculo buys one right away. (-10)
  2. A roll of 9/5 as the first pair causes them to buy Minesweeping 1 (-10)
  3. A roll of 9/3 as the second pair causes them to buy Defense 1 (-20)
  4. A roll of 9/3 again would normally buy Defense 2, but is incompatible with Ship Size 2. Trinculo instead buys Ship Size 3 (-15), and has 5 CP leftover
  5. The largest size available is a single Destroyer (-9). This spends all compatible CP
  6. They get a free Light Infantry Transport on top of the rest of the fleet

  7. Round 1: We gain the Fleet Size Bonus this time. Experience is equal still; by virtue of all ships involved having existed for a full economic phase
  8. Yet... their Destroyer has the best weapon class, so it goes first. It rolled a 4 (hit ≤4). Since it scored a hit, it also rolled an 8 for experience (miss >2)
  9. Their Transport has the tactics advantage. It rolled a 3 (miss >3)
  10. Our 4 Scouts will prioritize their Destroyer first. We rolled 1,2,4,6 (2 hits ≤2), finishing this fleet off
  11. For experience, our scouts rolled 9,10 (0 hits ≤2)

stages.heading: Stardate 2406.0
stages.commentary:
Another Alien Player fleet eliminated, making it a little bit easier on us. We will buy Minesweeping 1 (-10), followed by a colony ship at J9 (-8), and a Minesweeper at K4 (-6). We then buy 6 Scouts at our homeworld (-36).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Alien Players have gained a natural economic roll, making this economic phase dicier than the previous phases. They rolled 1,7,7 (Trinculo) / 2,4,8 (Umbriel). Trinculo's extra economic roll takes effect on phase 9, but does not have enough fleet CP to commence a fleet launch. Umbriel rolls a 4 alone, barely satisfying the threshold and launching a fresh large fleet. They do not have enough technology CP to buy Movement, so that concludes this phase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2406.3
stages.commentary: We uncover the first supernova of the playthrough. This significantly inhibits Trinculo's options from here on out.

stages.heading: Stardate 2406.6
stages.commentary:
Having taken advantage of recent limitations, we intercept Trinculo's other fleet.

  1. Preparation: Trinculo has gained more technology CP, so we will spend that first. On the Ship Size step, a 4 is rolled (buy for -20). This already spends them as much as possible
  2. As usual, a Destroyer is the largest ship this fleet can afford. (-9). Same composition as last time

  3. Round 1: Unlike last time, we will go on ahead and screen our Minesweeper. We want to be able to use it against Trinculo
  4. Their ships go first, like last time. They rolled 8/6 (0 hits ≤4/1)
  5. Our 5 Scouts rolled 1,1,3,4,6 (3 hits ≤3). After finishing them off, they rolled 5,6 for experience (0 hits ≤2)

stages.heading: Stardate 2406.9
stages.commentary: Having removed Trinculo's last fleet presently, our western fleet makes a sweeping advance towards their homeworld. Our eastern fleet consolidates to improve our odds against Umbriel's newest fleet, worth 41 CP.

stages.heading: Stardate 2407.0
stages.commentary:
Our income continues to grow still. Meanwhile, we believe it is past time to buy Ship Size 2 (-10). We also buy 1 Minesweeper at J9 (-6), 1 Scout + 1 Ship Yard at K4 (-12), and 6 Scouts at the homeworld (-36).

{prodTable}{techTable}

It is no longer possible to queue more extra economic rolls. Still, Umbriel's extra roll will take effect the phase after. The Alien Players have rolled 1,8,8 (Trinculo) / 3,4,9 (Umbriel). Both players are eligible for fleet launch, and rolled 9 (Trinculo) / 4 (Umbriel). Umbriel launches another fleet. They are also eligible for a Movement roll. They rolled a 6 (skip).

stages.heading: Stardate 2407.2
stages.commentary: If the launches were reversed, we could have split our Colony Ship off from the rest of our eastern fleet. As is, its still unsafe to do so.

stages.heading: Stardate 2407.5
stages.commentary:
We are permitted to include it with our fleet as we intercept their fleet. Since there is remote utility (1 unexplored hex nearby), we will do so.

The Battle for Sector H9

Skipping to the Ship Size step, Umbriel rolls a 3 (buy for -15), finishing the tech step off. Now for the scary part; they have 41 assigned CP to spend on ships. Cruisers were just unlocked, so they will buy one right away (-12). With no Scanning tech, we go straight to fleet composition. An 8 was rolled, buying the largest ships available (2 more Cruisers for -24).

  1. Round 1: We have brought 12 combat ships into battle. They have 4. We will screen our minesweeper each round (if able); and also benefit from Fleet Size Bonus. Experience is equal at first
  2. Our Flagship has the best weapon class, so it goes first. Their Transport is squishy, so we will target it first. We rolled a 3 (hit ≤4). We then rolled a 7 for experience (miss >2)
  3. Their 3 Cruisers are next. Our Scouts are just as squishy as their Transport, so they are Umbriel's primary target. The cruisers rolled 1,1,9 (2 hits ≤4). They then rolled 1,1 for experience (2 hits ≤2). They have now reached Veteran skill.
  4. Our 8 Scouts are next. Only their Cruisers remain, so we rolled 3,2,10,1,3,4,8,1 (5 hits ≤3)
  5. We almost managed to finish their fleet off. Still, our Scouts rolled 8,2 for experience (1 hit ≤4). Our largest group of 6 Scouts has also become Veteran

  6. Round 2: Our Flagship rolls a 3 (hit ≤4), followed by an 8 (no level >4). This finishes their fleet off

stages.heading: Stardate 2407.8
stages.commentary:
Well... Doomsday Machines are not used in an Alien Empires scenario.

The First Battle for Altair

Meanwhile, our western fleet has finally made it to Altair, the homeworld of Trinculo! Before we can do the battle, we need to spend all available banks. They have 25 tech CP, but this battle means they will not roll for Movement even though they can afford it. A 7 is rolled on each of the Military Academy and Ship Size steps (skip on each). 3/6 is then rolled, causing them to buy Fighters 1 (-25). Their 12 fleet CP is good for just a single Cruiser (-12).

  1. Round 1: We have brought 6 combat ships into battle. They have 3 ships. We will screen no ships, and gain the Fleet Size Bonus
  2. Their ships have the best weapon class, so they shoot first. They rolled 2/6 against our Scouts (1 hit ≤ 7/4). Since the Base scored a kill, it is ineligible for experience
  3. Our 5 ships rolled 9,7,3 against their Transport (1 hit ≤3), followed by 5/4 against their Cruiser (0 hits ≤3/1)

  4. Round 2: The ship count is now 5:2
  5. Their ships rolled 9/1 against our Scouts (1 hit ≤7/4). Since the Cruiser scored a kill, it then rolls a 10 for experience (miss >2)
  6. Our 4 ships decide to retreat out of this. Strength in numbers only does so much when their Defense is very high. We still denied their ability to stockpile fleet CP though.

stages.heading: Stardate 2408.0
stages.commentary:
Not exactly the most favorable battle, but it could be worse. We kept 4 of the 6 ships that we attempted to assault Altair with; and will wait until we get more ships consolidated. We will go on ahead and buy Ship Size 3 (-15). We then buy 1 Cruiser (-12) + 1 Scout (-6) + 1 Ship Yard (-6) at K4, 1 Minesweeper (-6) + 1 Ship Yard (-6) at J9.

{prodTable}{techTable}

Umbriel's extra economic roll has taken effect now. The Alien Players have rolled 4,10,10 (Trinculo) / 2,3,10,10 (Umbriel). The surge of Defense CP makes it much harder for us to keep pressuring their homeworlds. Still, for fleet launch, they rolled 6 (Trinculo) / 5 (Umbriel). No launch takes place this phase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2408.1
stages.commentary:
While Trinculo's cruiser is currently protected by unexplored terrain, we intercept Umbriel's last known fleet.

The Battle for Sector I10

Their tech CP is insufficient to buy anything; so we go straight to ship construction. With no priority ships necessary, they go to the largest ship step; a Cruiser (-12). Only other ships affordable is a single Scout (-6), so that ends this step.

  1. Round 1: We have 10 ships. They have 3. We will screen our Minesweeper, and gain the Fleet Size Bonus
  2. Our Flagship has the best weapon class, so we will use this opportunity to set a priority list: Scout → Transport → Cruiser
  3. With the priorities in place, we are ready to shoot. Our Flagship rolled a 7 (miss >5)
  4. Their ships rolled 9/4/10 against our Scouts (0 hits ≤4/3/1)
  5. Reflecting our partial experience advantage, our 8 Scouts rolled 2,3,3,4,9,10/5,7 (4 hits ≤5/4). Our most experienced scouts then rolled 1,6/5 on the experience step (2 hits ≤2/5). Our squad of 6 scouts has now become Elite!

stages.heading: Stardate 2408.4
stages.commentary: We finally found another planet suitable for colonization.

stages.heading: Stardate 2408.7 (The Battle for Romulus)
stages.commentary:
Our western fleet has now intercepted Trinculo's lone cruiser. Since this ship is previously known, we go straight into battle.

  1. Round 1: We have 13 ships. Their cruiser is all alone. We will screen our Minesweeper, and gain the Fleet Size Bonus
  2. Their cruiser has the tactics advantage, and rolls a 3 against our Scouts (hit ≤4). They then roll a 9 for experience (miss >2)
  3. Our cruiser rolls a 1 (hit ≤3)
  4. Our 11 scouts rolled 1,3,3,4,5,8/1,1,4,8,9 (3 hits ≤2). One of our 6 scouts then rolled a 3 for experience (success ≤5), promoting them to veteran skill

stages.heading: Stardate 2409.0
stages.commentary:
This may be our best economic phase yet. Despite the surge of their Defense banks, we have managed to eliminate their outstanding fleets. Combined with Efficient Factories now granting us an extra 10 CP in total, this makes it easier to plan more potential assaults against one or both of their homeworlds.

Before we decide where to spend, we need to decide which of the next two alien technologies is worth adding to our collection: The Captain's Chair, or Soylent Purple. Considering our current strategy, the latter is easily the best choice (-10), having almost managed to pay for itself already when it sharply reduced our maintenance! (20 → 11)

Anyway, we buy 1 Colony Ship + 1 Cruiser + 1 Ship Yard at K4 (-26 total); 1 Ship Yard + 1 Cruiser at J9 (-18 total). All leftover Ship Yard capacity is then spent on Pipelines (-24 total)

{prodTable}{techTable}

Trinculo's extra economic roll takes effect now; which is the final extra roll possible this playthrough. Additional natural rolls can still be added though, and they are due for the next one very soon. Anyway, Alien Players have rolled 3,5,5,10 (Trinculo) / 4,7,8,9 (Umbriel).

Their fleet launch rolls are 5 (Trinculo) / 10 (Umbriel). Trinculo has an aggression bonus from Fighters (threshold +2), and will launch! But has no tech CP to even consider Movement technology.

stages.heading: Stardate 2409.3
stages.commentary: The revelation of a space wreck changes where we send our Miner.

stages.heading: Stardate 2409.6
stages.commentary: We have found another planet suitable for colonization.

stages.heading: Stardate 2409.9
stages.commentary:
We take advantage of Trinculo's pathing. With their Movement only at 1, combined with having just started colonization of Romulus, they make every attempt to assault our newly founded colony.

The Battle for Romulus

They may have no tech CP, but they can take advantage of having previously known Fighters 1. Without having known Point-Defense ourselves, their priority builds this time are a full carrier (-27), before going to the regular step. The largest ship they can build this time to support their carrier... is just a cruiser (-12). (Not enough money to afford a battlecruiser.)

  1. Round 1: We have 12 ships at our disposal. Trinculo has 6. Since their Defense bank has hit the roof, we will forgo the Fleet Size Bonus, and screen our Minesweeper. We have the experience advantage though (Skilled/Veteran > Green)
  2. Their Fighters have the best weapon class, so they go first. Against our Scouts (Skilled first), they rolled 2,6,8 (1 hit ≤5). On the experience step, they rolled a 3 (miss >2)
  3. Our 1 Cruiser then rolls a 2 against their Transport (hit ≤3), followed by an 8 for experience (miss >2)
  4. Their 1 Cruiser rolls a 4 against out Skilled Scouts (hit ≤4), followed by a 7 for experience (miss >2)
  5. Our 6 Veteran Scouts rolled 3,4,5,5,7,8 against their Fighters (1 hit ≤3), followed by a 5 for experience (miss >2)
  6. Our remaining 2 Skilled Scouts rolled 9,1 against their Fighter (1 hit ≤3), followed by a 6 for experience (miss >2)
  7. Their Carrier rolled a 7 against our Skilled Scouts (miss >3)

  8. Round 2: We have 10 ships at our disposal. Trinculo has 3. We can keep our Minesweeper screened, and gain the Fleet Size Bonus
  9. Their last Fighter shoots again. Against our Skilled Scouts, it rolled a 7 (miss >5)
  10. Our 1 Cruiser then rolls a 7 against their last Fighter (miss >5)
  11. Their 1 Cruiser rolls a 7 against out Skilled Scouts (miss >4)
  12. Our 6 Veteran Scouts rolled a 5,6,4 against their last Fighter (1 hit ≤4), followed by a 2 against their Carrier (hit ≤4), and 3,9 against their Cruiser (1 hit ≤3). They then rolled 3,10 for experience (0 hits ≤2)
  13. Our 2 Skilled Scouts rolled 6,7 against their Cruiser (0 hits ≤3)

  14. Round 3: Our 1 Cruiser rolls a 2 against their Cruiser (hit ≤4), followed by a 10 for experience (miss >4). This finishes their fleet off!

stages.heading: Stardate 2410.0
stages.commentary:
Trinculo's newest carrier fleet has been demolished! Still, before we do any purchases, we need to make another decision regarding more alien technology. Our choices this time are Minesweep Jammer, and Holodeck. Considering how cheap and effective countermeasures (still) are to these choices, we will buy neither of these two cards.

We buy 5 Minesweepers (-30) + 1 Colony Ship (-8) at K4, and 4 Minesweepers at J9 (-24). We then buy 1 Ship Yard at each of K4, J9, and J12 (-18 total).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Alien Players have gained a natural economic roll at this point. They have rolled 1,6,9,10,10 (Trinculo) / 5,9,9,10,10 (Umbriel). For fleet launch, they rolled 2 (Trinculo) / 5 (Umbriel). Both Alien Players launch fresh fleets! Only Umbriel has the money necessary to roll for Movement tech, having rolled a 10 (skip).

stages.heading: Stardate 2410.2
stages.commentary: Probably fortunate that we have built more Minesweepers for each fleet. 100 Defense CP per Alien Player is extremely scary, and they still have 2 economic phases left to build these banks even further! Unless... one or both players roll for maximum bases! 8 Bases is worth 96 CP, and 4 CP is not sufficient for even one minelayer.

stages.heading: Stardate 2410.5
stages.commentary:
We can take advantage of their slow fleet movement speeds, and snag some last minute minerals while still being barely protected.

The Battle for Deneb

Umbriel's fleet arrives at our distant colony of Deneb, so we will conduct this battle first. Since it takes place over a planet, it gives them a single priority tech; so they will go on ahead and buy Troops 2 (-10). On the Military Academy step, they rolled a 9 (skip). On the Ship Size step, they roll a 2 (buy for -20). On the extra techs step, they rolled 10/9; causing them to buy an extra Ship Size on top of that (-20 more)! This knocks them down to 5 CP, so that ends the tech step.

With no priority ships applicable still, Battleships are now the largest ship they can afford, so their first ship is built as such (-20). Their fleet composition roll is 5 (Balanced). With no Attack/Defense tech, this causes them to buy 3 Scouts (-18) and 1 Destroyer (-9). This spends all of their assigned CP.

  1. Round 1: We have 13 ships. They have 6 ships. We will screen our Ship Yard, and gain the Fleet Size Bonus, but the same experience (sans one of our Scout groups)
  2. Their Battleship has the best weapon class, so it goes first. Going after our Skilled Scouts, it rolled a 9 (miss >5)
  3. Our Flagship is next. Their Space Marines-loaded Transport is an extreme threat, so we will roll a 1 against it (hit ≤4). We then roll a 1 for experience (hit ≤2), promoting our Flagship to Veteran.
  4. Our 1 Cruiser is next. Against their Destroyer, we rolled a 3 (hit ≤5), followed by a 10 for experience (miss >2)
  5. Our 8 Scouts are next. 6 of them are Elite, giving those an accuracy advantage. Against their Scouts, we rolled 9,2,2,2 (3 hits ≤5). We then rolled 6,7/2,4 against their Battleship (1 hit ≤3/2). The Elite Scouts then rolled 2,3,6 (1 hit ≤2), promoting them to Legendary!
  6. Our Minesweepers then rolled 1,2 against their Battleship (1 hit ≤1)

  7. Round 2: Their Battleship is all alone, but shoots again. It rolled a 5 against our Skilled Scouts (hit ≤5). It then rolled a 2 for experience, promoting it to Veteran (≤2)
  8. Our Flagship rolls a 10 (miss >3)
  9. Our 1 Cruiser rolls a 7 (miss ≤3)
  10. Our 7 Scouts are next. Using our last Skilled Scout first, we rolled 7/2,3,5,5,6,9 (2 hits ≤2/3). This finishes off their fleet. Our victorious Legendary Scouts are already at maximum experience

stages.heading: Stardate 2410.8
stages.commentary:
With Umbriel's fleet destroyed, that leaves only Trinculo to exert their pressure.

The Battle for Romulus

Much like Umbriel, Trinculo has a priority tech it can afford to buy. Troops 2 causes it to spend all of its tech CP.

Being unable to afford carriers, Battlecruisers are instead the largest ship they can afford, so their first ship is built as such (-15). The only other ships they can afford is a single Scout (-6). This spends all of their assigned CP.

  1. Round 1: We have 15 ships. They have 3 ships. We have a decisive Fleet Size Bonus and also experience advantage! We will also screen our minesweepers
  2. Their Battlecruiser has the best weapon class, so it goes first. Against our Skilled Scouts, it rolled a 10 (miss >5)
  3. Our 1 Cruiser gets a chance now. Against their Transport, we rolled a 3 (hit ≤4). We then rolled a 1 for experience, promoting this Cruiser to Veteran
  4. Our 8 (6 Veteran + 2 Skilled) Scouts rolled a 1 against their Scout (hit ≤4), followed by 3,5,6,6,9/2,6 against their Battlecruiser (2 hits ≤3). The victorious Scouts then rolled 1/7, promoting the group of 6 to Elite!

stages.heading: Stardate 2411.0
stages.commentary:
Another very successful phase has been performed. Before we can proceed with purchases, we need to draw even more alien technology. This time, we can choose between Electronic Warfare Module, and Adaptive Cloaking Device. We have a few Cruisers in service, so the former would be helpful to buy (-10). Additionally, we cashed in a space wreck. We rolled a 9, granting us Movement 2.

To supplement the recent acquisition of technology, we should set aside 34 CP for upgrades. This allows us to buy Attack 1 (-20), Defense 1 (-20), Minesweeping 2 (-15). We will finally build Ship Yards at I3 and J12 (-12).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Alien Player aggression has slowed a bit. Still, they rolled 1,4,5,8,9 (Trinculo) / 2,4,5,10,10 (Umbriel). For fleet launch, they rolled 10 (Trinculo) / 9 (Umbriel). Even with Trinculo's Fighters aggression bonus (threshold +2), no launch takes place this phase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2411.1
stages.commentary: We use this turn to perform the necessary upgrades. Aside from one Cruiser (out of position at the time), all obsoleted ships have been upgraded with the latest technology! The 34 CP we previously set aside was spent.

stages.heading: Stardate 2411.4
stages.commentary: We may have an extremely explosive turn soon. Hopefully we are well prepared for the massive variety of potential consequences...

stages.heading: Stardate 2411.7 (The Second Battle for Altair)
stages.commentary:
It is not every day we assault both Alien Player homeworlds! We will start with Trinculo's Altair. Since their homeworld is under assault, they will not roll for Movement tech, even though they can afford it. Instead, they start on the Military Academy step, and rolled a 9 (skip). On the Ship Size step, they rolled a 4 (skip). On the Fighters step, they rolled an 8 (skip). On the extra techs step, they rolled 8/9, which causes them to buy Ship Size 5 anyway (-20).

With 30 CP available, carriers are their highest priority. They already finish the ship step after buying one full carrier for 27 CP. With their Defense bank, since they have Troops 2+; they roll a 9, causing them to buy that many Heavy Infantry. Their defense composition roll afterwards is a 3, giving them 14 minelayers!

  1. Round 1: They almost managed to make a fool out of us. Our recently upgraded Minesweepers were able to sweep 12 of their mines. Leftover minelayers then eliminated our 2 cruisers in one fell swoop
  2. Now that minelayer ammunition has been spent, we then compare fleets. We have 14 ships remaining. They have 5 ships. We will screen no ships, and gain the Fleet Size Bonus
  3. Their 1 Base has the best weapon class. Against our Skilled Scouts, they rolled an 8 (miss >7)
  4. Their 3 Fighters have rolled 2,6,7 against our Skilled Scouts (1 hit ≤4). They then rolled an 8 for experience (miss >2)
  5. Their Carrier and Transport then rolled 6,8 against our last Skilled Scout (0 hits ≤2)
  6. Our 7 Scouts (Skilled first) then respond by rolling 1/1,1,1 against their Fighters and Carrier (4 hits ≤5), followed by a 2 against their Transport (hits ≤4), and 3,3 against their Base (0 hits ≤2). Our Scouts then rolled 9/2,4,6,9 for experience. The Elite group of 6 is now Legendary!
  7. Our 6 Minesweepers rolled 4,5,5,6,6,7 against their Base (0 hits ≤1)

  8. Round 2: Their 1 Base rolls again. Another 8 against our last Skilled Scout (miss >7)
  9. Our 7 Scouts 1,1,5,7,8,9,10 against their Base (2 hits ≤2)
  10. Our 6 Minesweepers rolled 2,2,3,3,5,7 (0 hits ≤1)

  11. Round 3: Their 1 Base rolls a 1 against our Skilled Scout (hit ≤7). Bases neither gain nor give experience
  12. Our 6 Scouts 1,1,8,8,9,9 (2 hits ≤2), finishing their base off

  13. Bombardment Round: With the defenders eliminated, Altair is now exposed. Still, the sheer number of ground units makes it difficult to damage (Defense 2)!
  14. Our Scouts rolled 2,3,3,5,6,10 (1 hit ≤2)
  15. Our Minesweepers rolled 1,4,5,5,7,7 (1 hit ≤1)

stages.heading: Stardate 2411.7 (The First Battle for Chulak)
stages.commentary:
Now that the battle and bombardment against Altair have concluded, that leaves only Chulak. With virtually no tech CP, we go straight into the ship step. Their largest ship is a Battleship (-20). Fleet Composition roll is meaningless when all results yield a Destroyer (-9).

Much like Altair, they can build Heavy Infantry. They rolled a 10 accordingly. Their defense composition roll is a 5, causing them to build 6 Bases and 7 Minelayers.

  1. Round 1: Our minesweepers negated their ammunition. We have 15 ships, to their 10 ships. We will screen no ships. Neither side gets the Fleet Size Bonus
  2. Their 7 Bases have the best weapon class, so they go first. Against our last Skilled Scout and then Minesweepers, they rolled 7,2/4,5,7,9,9 (3 hits ≤6)
  3. Their Battleship rolls an 8 against our Minesweepers (miss >4)
  4. Our Flagship rolls a 4 against their Destroyer (hit ≤6), followed by a 10 for experience (miss >2)
  5. Our 1 Cruiser rolls a 3 against their Transport (hit ≤5), followed by an 8 for experience (miss >2)
  6. Our 6 Legendary Scouts rolled 8,8,8,8,8,9 against their Battleship (0 hits ≤3)
  7. Our 4 Minesweepers rolled 3,4,5,6 against their Battleship (0 hits ≤1)

  8. Round 2: (12:8) Their 7 Bases shoot once more. They rolled 1,4,6,7,7,7,10 against our Minesweepers (3 hits ≤6)
  9. Their Battleship rolls an 8 against our last Minesweeper (miss >4)
  10. Our Flagship rolls a 1 against their Battleship (hit ≤4). This damages their ship to 2 HP
  11. Our 1 Cruiser rolls a 3 against their Battleship (hit ≤4). This further damages their ship to 1 HP
  12. Our 6 Legendary Scouts rolled 7,5,2 against their Battleship (1 hit ≤3), followed by 1,2,9 against their Bases (2 hits ≤2). Since our Scouts are already at maximum experience, we skip the level up step
  13. With their Bases all alone, our last Minesweeper rolls a 3 (miss >1)

  14. Round 3: (9:7) Their 7 Bases shoot once more. They rolled a 6 against our Minesweepers, followed by 1,4,4,6,7,10 against our Legendary Scouts (5 hits total ≤6). We lost 2 scouts this way
  15. Our Flagship rolls a 7 (miss >3)
  16. Our 1 Cruiser rolls a 4 (hit ≤4). This finishes one of their bases
  17. Our 4 Legendary Scouts rolled 5,8,10,10 (0 hits ≤2)

  18. Round 4: (6:6) Their 6 Bases rolled 3,3,4,5,5,6 against our Legendary Scouts (6 hits total ≤6), killing another 3.
  19. Our surviving 3 ships decide to retreat. This has gotten out of hand, but we at least denied Umbriel a fleet

stages.heading: Stardate 2412.0
stages.commentary:
Not ideal, but we did effectively empty their banks, sharply reducing their uncertainty as we approach the late game. We will go on ahead and buy Ship Yards 3 (-25). We then buy 1 Cruiser + 1 Ship Yard at I3 (-18 total), 2 Cruisers + 1 Ship Yard at J12 (-30 total), and 7 Scouts at J9 (-42).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Despite the significant reduction in uncertainty, Alien Players still have one last economic phase to rebuild their Defense CP. They rolled 5,5,8,10,10 (Trinculo) / 1,3,7,7,8 (Umbriel). Umbriel's homeworld is presently safe, so they roll a 4 for fleet launch (skip).

Trinculo's homeworld is being beseiged, so their fleet automatically launches. On the Military Academy step, they rolled a 2 (buy for -10), spending all their Tech CP. Since they are barely unable to afford a carrier, they instead build a Battleship (-20). On the protection step, they rolled a 8 to build that much Heavy Infantry (-24), followed by a defense composition roll of 5 to rebuild 1 each of base and minelayer.

stages.heading: Stardate 2412.3 (The Third Battle for Altair)
stages.commentary:
The battle at Altair continues. Since we identified Trinculo's ships during the previous economic phase, we will go straight into battle.

  1. Round 1: Their sole minelayer's ammunition has already been swept. We have 12 ships, to their 3. We will screen no ships, and gain the fleet size bonus
  2. Their base has the best weapon class, so it goes first. Against our Minesweepers, it rolled a 7 (miss >6)
  3. Their battleship rolled a 4 against our Minesweepers (hit ≤4). It then rolled an 8 for experience (miss >2)
  4. Our 6 Legendary Scouts rolled a 1 against their Transport, followed by 10,2,6,3,3 against their battleship (3 hits ≤3). Experience at maximum
  5. Our 5 Minesweepers rolled 3,3,3,4,7 against their Base (0 hits ≤1)

  6. Round 2: Their base, being all alone, continues against our minesweepers. It rolled a 3 (hit ≤6)
  7. Our 6 scouts rolled 2,3,5,5,7,8 (1 hit ≤2)
  8. Our 4 Minesweepers rolled 2,5,5,7 (0 hits ≤1)

  9. Round 3: Their base rolls a 2 against our minesweepers (hit ≤6)
  10. Our 6 scouts rolled 3,3,4,5,7,7 (0 hits ≤2)
  11. Our 3 Minesweepers rolled 2,9,10 (0 hits ≤1)

  12. Round 4: Their base rolls a 4 against our minesweepers (hit ≤6)
  13. Our 6 scouts rolled 2,4,7,7,8,9 (1 hit ≤2)
  14. Our 2 Minesweepers rolled 2,8 (0 hits ≤1)

  15. Round 5: Their base rolls a 1 against our minesweepers (hit ≤6)
  16. Our 6 scouts rolled 1,2,4,7,7,9 (2 hits ≤2), finishing their base off

  17. Bombardment Round: Our 6 scouts rolled 4,4,5,6,7,10 (0 hits ≤2). Our last minesweeper then rolls a 4 (miss >1)

stages.heading: Stardate 2412.6
stages.commentary: The bombardment against Altair continues. Our ships rolled 1,4,7,7,8,10/3 (1 hit ≤2/1)

stages.heading: Stardate 2412.9
stages.commentary: The bombardment against Altair continues, still. With a little help from a Cruiser that just arrived, our ships rolled 10/1,2,2,4,4,7/8 (3 hits ≤4/2/1). We finally finish off Trinculo!

stages.heading: Stardate 2413.0
stages.commentary:
We have managed to eliminate Trinculo just before reaching the late game! Since the threats of minelayers are no more, we have scuttled our last minesweeper to slightly save on maintenance. We buy 1 Cruiser + 2 Colony Ships at I3 (-28 total), 5 Scouts at J9 (-30), and 3 Cruisers + 1 Ship Yard at J12 (-42 total)

{prodTable}{techTable}

Since only Umbriel made it to the late game, subsequent economic phases become a little easier. Their economic rolls are 2,3,4,8,10. Their fleet launch roll is an 8. No launch takes place this phase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2413.2
stages.commentary: We will go on ahead and prepare for a rematch with Chulak. Sure, there is a considerable risk; but if we succeed, this scenario will be victorious. In short, risk versus reward.

stages.heading: Stardate 2413.5 (The Second Battle for Chulak)
stages.commentary:
The time has come to have a rematch with Chulak. Since their homeworld is under assault, they will launch their fleet now. On the Military Academy step, they roll a 9 (skip). On the Ship Size step, they roll an 8 (also skip). Leading to the extra techs step, they rolled 6/1, causing them to buy Attack 1 (-20). A 10/1 causes them to buy Attack 2 (-30), and exhausting their tech CP.

On the ship step, they go straight for the largest ship; a battleship (-20). The fleet composition roll is a 1, causing them to build 5 scouts (-30).

  1. Round 1: We brought 15 ships. They have 13 ships. We will screen no ships. Neither side gets the fleet size bonus
  2. Their bases have the best weapon class, so they go first. They rolled 2,4,4,6,7,10 against our less experienced scouts (5 hits ≤8)
  3. Their battleship rolls a 2 against our Skilled scouts (hit ≤6)
  4. Our Flagship rolls a 10 against their transport (miss >5)
  5. Our 6 cruisers rolled 8,3 against their transport (1 hit ≤5), followed by 2,4,5,5 against their scouts (4 hits ≤6). They then rolled 2,4,6,6,8 (1 hit ≤2), promoting these Cruisers to Veteran
  6. Their last scout rolls a 10 against our last Skilled scout (miss >3)
  7. Our scouts then get their chance. Lowest experience first, we rolled a 2 against their last scout (hit ≤4), followed by a 6 against their battleship (miss >2). Our less experienced scout then rolls a 5 for experience (miss >2)

  8. Round 2: We have 9 ships. They have 7 ships. Still roughly even
  9. Their bases shoot once more. They rolled a 3 against our last Skilled scout (hit ≤8), followed by 7,6 against our last Legendary scout (2 hits ≤8), and 3,5,5 against our cruisers (3 hits ≤7)
  10. Their battleship rolls a 4 against our cruisers (hit ≤5)
  11. Our Flagship rolls a 1 against their battleship (hit ≤4)
  12. Our 4 cruisers rolled 7,7,3,3 against their battleship (2 hits ≤5), finishing this ship off. Experience gains are limited to 1 level per battle

  13. Round 3: We have 5 ships. They have 6 bases. This is not looking very good
  14. Their bases rolled 2,3,3,4,5,7 against our cruisers (6 hits ≤7)
  15. Our remaining ships decide to retreat at this time. The good news is we still denied them mobile ships

stages.heading: Stardate 2413.8
stages.commentary: Not the best, but at least we need only to worry about Umbriel.

stages.heading: Stardate 2414.0
stages.commentary:
Victors of Altair have partially completed the journey towards Chulak. Since we colonized Babbage for the first time, we draw yet more alien technology. Our choices this time are Advanced Comm Array, and Photon Bomb. We normally would dismiss both of these choices; but because Umbriel can no longer build minelayers, we will go for the latter (-10).

Taking advantage of recent opportunities, we will buy Fighters 1 (-25). We then buy 2 full carriers at J12 (-54), 6 Pipelines at K4 (-18), and 1 Pipeline at I3 (-3).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Umbriel's economic rolls are 3,4,5,7,8. Starting with this economic phase, each even numbered phase is an auto-launch. Instead, a 6 is rolled on the movement step (skip).

stages.heading: Stardate 2414.1
stages.commentary: Despite having just bought carriers, we will hold them back from the colony, to discourage Point-Defense as a technology purchase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2414.4 (The Battle for Deneb)
stages.commentary:
Their newest fleet has arrived. Since we have withheld our carriers from battle, they instead start on the Military Academy step. A 9 was rolled (skip). On the Ship Size step, a 3 was rolled (buy for -20), which spends their tech CP. Since they just unlocked Dreadnoughts, they will make that their first ship (-24). The remaining assigned CP is good for just a Scout (-6).

  1. Round 1: We have 7 ships. They have 3 ships. We will screen no ships, and gain the fleet size bonus
  2. Their Dreadnought has the best weapon class, so it goes first. Against our scouts, it rolled a 5 (hit ≤7). It then rolled a 10 for experience (miss >2)
  3. Our Veteran Flagship is next. We rolled a 4 against their transport (hit ≤6), followed by a 1 for experience (hit ≤2), promoting our flagship to Elite!
  4. Our Veteran Cruiser rolls a 6 against their scout (hit ≤7), followed by a 3 for experience (miss >2)
  5. Our 4 Skilled Scouts rolled 3,7,7,8 against their dreadnought (0 hits ≤2)

  6. Round 2: Their Dreadnought is all alone now. Against our scouts, it rolled a 7 (hit ≤7). It then rolled a 5 for experience (miss >2)
  7. Our Elite Flagship rolls a 2 (hit ≤4), knocking their final ship down to 2 HP
  8. Our Veteran Cruiser rolls a 6 (miss >5)
  9. Our 3 Skilled Scouts rolled 4,10,10 (0 hits ≤2)

  10. Round 3: Their Dreadnought rolls a 6 against our scouts (hit ≤7). It then rolled a 2 for experience (hit ≤2), promoting it to Veteran
  11. Our Elite Flagship rolls a 5 (miss >4)
  12. Our Veteran Cruiser rolls a 2 (hit ≤4), knocking their dreadnought down to 1 HP
  13. Our 2 Skilled Scouts rolled 6,7 (0 hits ≤2)

  14. Round 4: Their Veteran Dreadnought rolls a 1 against our scouts (hit ≤8). It already gained experience this battle
  15. Our Elite Flagship rolls a 8 (miss >4)
  16. Our Veteran Cruiser rolls a 2 (hit ≤4), finishing their dreadnought off. It then rolled a 7 for experience (hit ≤7), promoting it to Elite!

stages.heading: Stardate 2414.7
stages.commentary: How convenient. We found a mate to one of the warp points near Chulak!

stages.heading: Stardate 2415.0
stages.commentary:
Another fleet in ruins makes it that much easier for us. We will buy Fighters 2 (-25), and then throw down another 2 full carriers at J12. (-54 total). We then buy 5 scouts at J9 (-30).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Umbriel gains a natural economic roll. It rolls 5,6,6,7,9,9 this way. For fleet launch, it rolls an 8. No launch takes place this phase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2415.3
stages.commentary: While we are nearing Umbriel's homeworld, we will go on ahead and upgrade our older fighters for 6 CP.

stages.heading: Stardate 2415.6
stages.commentary: Still, we are bringing to bear nearly every starship that is able to reach it before phase 16.

stages.heading: Stardate 2415.9 (The Third Battle for Chulak)
stages.commentary:
So that we can end this struggle! Since Umbriel did not launch in the economic phase, it instead builds its defensive fleet here. Since this is the first time it sees fighters, it prioritizes Point-Defense 1 (-20); immediately spending its tech CP. As usual, the largest ship it can build is a dreadnought (-24). Since it now has a necessity for Point-Defense, there is now a -2 modifer to fleet composition. What would normally be a roll of 10 instead becomes a roll of 8. Since the largest fleet was not achieved, it buys 2 scouts (-12) before spending the rest of its non-existent fleet CP.

  1. Round 1: We have 27 ships. They have 10 ships. We will screen no ships, and gain the fleet size bonus
  2. Point-Defense weapons are active, causing their Scouts to have a boosted weapon class. Thus, they go first, and rolled 10,10 against our fighters (0 hits ≤6)
  3. Their 6 Bases have rolled 2,2,5,6,7,8 (6 hits ≤8), blowing one squadron of fighters out of the sky!
  4. Their Dreadnought then rolls a 1 against our fighters (hit ≤7), followed by an 8 for experience (miss >2)
  5. Our Flagship rolls a 4 against their transport (hit ≤6), followed by a 10 for experience (miss >2)
  6. Our 5 remaining fighters rolled 9,6,9,3,1 against their scouts (2 hits ≤8, followed by a 1 against the dreadnought (hit ≤5), damaging the last target to 2 HP. We then rolled 5,10 for experience (0 hits ≤2)
  7. Our 2 Skilled cruisers rolled 6,6 against their dreadnought (0 hits ≤4)
  8. Our 1 Elite cruiser rolled a 2 against their dreadnought (hit ≤5), further damaging this ship to 1 HP
  9. Our 7 Scouts (Skilled first) rolled 7/10,9,5,5,1 against their dreadnought (1 hit ≤2/3), finishing it off. We then rolled a 9 against their bases (miss >2). Our Legendary scouts scored the kill, so we skip the experience step
  10. Since their bases are all alone, our 4 Carriers rolled 1,9,10,10 (1 hit ≤2), damaging one of them to 2 HP

  11. Round 2: We have 20 ships. They have 6 bases
  12. Their 6 Bases have rolled 7,6,2,2,3 to clean up our fighters (5 hits ≤8), followed by a 2 against our least experienced scout (hit ≤8)
  13. Our Flagship rolls a 5 (miss >3)
  14. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 5,6,8 (0 hits ≤4)
  15. Our 6 Legendary scouts rolled 1,1,7,9,10,10 (2 hits ≤2), finishing one base off
  16. Our 4 Carriers rolled 2,5,6,9 (1 hit ≤2), damaging another to 2 HP

  17. Round 3: We have 14 ships. They have 5 bases. Our numbers are dropping like flies
  18. Their 5 Bases have rolled 3,1,5,6 to clean up our carriers (4 hits ≤8), followed by a 4 against our scouts (hit ≤8), damaging one of them
  19. Our Flagship rolls an 8 (miss >3)
  20. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 4,4,7 (2 hits ≤4), finishing another base off
  21. Our 6 scouts rolled 4,5,7,7,8,10 (0 hits ≤2)

  22. Round 4: We have 10 ships. They have 4 bases
  23. Their 4 Bases have rolled 3,1,5,6 against our scouts (4 hits ≤8), destroying 2 of them
  24. Our Flagship rolls a 4 (miss >3)
  25. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 2,7,7 (1 hit ≤4), damaging a third base to 2 HP
  26. Our 4 scouts rolled 5,6,6,8 (0 hits ≤2)

  27. Round 5: We have 8 ships. They have 4 bases. We barely hold the fleet size bonus
  28. Their 4 Bases have rolled 2,7,10,10 against our scouts (2 hits ≤8), destroying 1 more
  29. Our Flagship rolls a 10 (miss >3)
  30. Our 3 Cruisers 1,9,9 (1 hit ≤4), damaging a third base to 1 HP
  31. Our 3 scouts rolled 6,6,9 (0 hits ≤2)

  32. Round 6: We have 7 ships. They have 4 bases. We no longer have the fleet size bonus
  33. Their 4 Bases have rolled 4,4,5,10 against our scouts (3 hits ≤8), destroying 2 more
  34. Our Flagship rolls a 1 (hit ≤2), finishing the third base
  35. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 2,7,8 (1 hit ≤3), damaging a fourth base to 2 HP
  36. Our last scout rolled a 10 (miss >1)

  37. Round 7: We have 5 ships. They have 3 bases
  38. Their 3 Bases have rolled 10,5,8 against our scouts (2 hits ≤8), finishing them exactly
  39. Our Flagship rolls a 10 (miss >2)
  40. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 2,4,4 (1 hit ≤3), damaging a fourth base to 1 HP

  41. Round 8: We have 4 ships. They have 3 bases
  42. Their 3 Bases have rolled 1,5,7 against our cruisers (3 hits ≤8), destroying 1 of them
  43. Our remaining 3 ships rolled 7/1,8 (1 hit ≤2/3), destroying the fourth base

  44. Round 9: We have 3 ships. They have 2 bases
  45. Their 2 Bases have rolled 6,10 against our cruisers (1 hit ≤8), finishing a second off
  46. Our remaining 2 ships rolled a 8/8 (0 hits ≤2/3)

  47. Round 10: We have 2 ships. They have 2 bases
  48. Their 2 Bases have rolled 6,6 against our last cruiser (2 hits ≤8), destroying it
  49. Our Flagship decides to retreat at this time

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.0
stages.commentary:
2 phases worth of preparation, and their 6 bases were still too strong. We managed to destroy 4 of them though, and they will not be able to replace them. Photon Bombs are not as potent as we give them credit, though that might be partially because B6 fighters have natural defense 0, making them very easy to shoot down.

Anyway, we buy Attack 2 (-30), Defense 2 (-30), Movement 3 (-25). We then buy 3 Cruisers at J12 (-36).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Umbriel now conducts its economic rolls, having rolled 1,1,4,5,7,9. Fleet Launch is automatic. Its Tech bank is not sufficient to roll for Movement tech, so we finish this economic phase.

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.2
stages.commentary: We move our Flagship home to upgrade it further with the latest equipment. This process requires our last 3 CP.

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.5 (The Battle for Deneb)
stages.commentary:
The upgrades were installed just in time for Umbriel's newest fleet to arrive. Only two choices are affordable for 15 CP, so we speed up the process by rolling one die. Odd says Minesweeping 2 is bought (-15).

As usual, the largest ship is still a dreadnought (-24). The fleet composition roll is 6 (8 before applying Point-Defense mod), which still does not give them the largest fleet. Thus, they build 2 Scouts (-12) before going for the Balanced composition. They take advantage of Attack 2, and build a battlecruiser (-15) with the leftover money.

  1. Round 1: We have 9 ships. They have 5. We will screen no ships. No fleet size bonus takes place yet. Experience is Skilled, unless specified otherwise
  2. We have no fighters, so point-defense weapons are inactive. Instead, their Dreadnought goes first, and rolls a 10 against our scouts (miss >7)
  3. Our Elite Flagship rolls a 9 against their transport (miss >6)
  4. Their Battlecruiser rolls a 9 against our scouts (miss >6)
  5. Our 3 Green Cruisers rolled 7,10,10 against their transport (0 hits ≤6)
  6. Our 5 Scouts rolled 9,5,3 against their transport (1 hit ≤3), followed by 1,7 against their scouts (1 hit ≤4). 7,8 is then rolled for experience (0 hits ≤2)
  7. Their last Scout rolls an 8 against our scouts (miss >3)

  8. Round 2: We still have 9 ships. They have 3. We gained the fleet size bonus
  9. Their Dreadnought rolls another 10 against our scouts (miss >7)
  10. Our Flagship rolls a 1 against their last scout (hit ≤7), followed by a 2 to achieve Legendary experience! (≤2 to hit)
  11. Their Battlecruiser rolls a 8 against our scouts (miss >6)
  12. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 1,5 against their battlecruiser (2 hits ≤7), followed by a 7 against their dreadnought (0 hits ≤5). They then rolled a 4 for experience (hit ≤4), promoting them to Skilled
  13. Since their dreadnought is all alone, our 5 Scouts rolled 1,5,6,8,8 (1 hit ≤2). They are down to 2 HP

  14. Round 3: Their Dreadnought rolls a 6 against our scouts (hit ≤7)
  15. Our Legendary Flagship rolls a 10 (miss ≤5)
  16. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 1,5,10 against their dreadnought (2 hits ≤5), finishing it off. Experience gains were already capped this battle

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.8
stages.commentary: And thus eliminates yet another fleet.

stages.heading: Stardate 2417.0
stages.commentary:
And, therefore, another economic phase. We will go on ahead and buy Fighters 3 (-25). We buy 2 full carriers at J12 (-54), and an extra full carrier + 1 Colony Ship + 2 Pipelines at J9 (-41 total).

{prodTable}{techTable}

Umbriel conducts its economics once more. It rolls 1,3,4,4,7,8. For fleet launch, it rolls a 6. No launch takes place.

stages.heading: Stardate 2417.1
stages.commentary: While waiting for our combat ships to reach Umbriel's homeworld, we have to say; Umbriel's bases have probably been their most cost-efficient spending yet, likely scoring hundreds of CP worth of kills at this point.

stages.heading: Stardate 2417.4
stages.commentary: Movement 3 makes subsequent homeworld assaults more effective (and also makes it easier to defend Deneb).

stages.heading: Stardate 2417.7 (The Fourth Battle for Chulak)
stages.commentary:
We meet yet again, Chulak! Since Umbriel has only fleet CP to spend, we proceed straight to this step. Their largest ship is a dreadnought (-24). Their fleet composition roll is a 3 (5 before applying Fighters modifier), causing them to spam 5 scouts (-30) and 1 destroyer (-9).

  1. Round 1: We brought 20 ships this time. They have 10. We will screen no ships. We barely have enough for a fleet size bonus
  2. Point-Defense weapon are active, so their scouts achieve the best weapon class. They rolled 5,6,7,7,7 accordingly (2 hits ≤6). They then rolled 3,4 for experience (0 hits ≤2)
  3. Their dreadnought then rolls a 5 against our scouts (hit ≤7), followed by an 8 for experience (miss >2)
  4. Their 2 bases rolled 8,8 against our scouts (2 hits ≤8)
  5. Our 7 Green Fighters rolled 10,9/8,1,4,4,8 against their destroyer and scouts (6 hits ≤9/9). Experience rolls are 4,3,3,5,2,4 (1 hit ≤2), promoting the group of 6 to Skilled
  6. Our Legendary Flagship rolls a 1 against their dreadnought (hit ≤5), damaging it to 2 HP
  7. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 10,8,4 against their dreadnought (1 hit ≤5), further damaging it to 1 HP
  8. Their Transport rolls a 4 against our last scout (miss >3)
  9. Our Scout and 3 Carriers rolled an 8/3,9,9 against their dreadnought (0 hits ≤2/2)

  10. Round 2: We have 15 ships this time. They have 4. We keep the fleet size bonus
  11. Their dreadnought rolls an 8 against our last scout (miss >7)
  12. Their 2 bases rolled a 5 against our scout (hit ≤8), followed by a 5 against our fighters (hit ≤7)
  13. Our last Green Fighter rolled a 6 against their dreadnought (hit ≤7), followed by a 5 for experience (miss >2)
  14. Our 5 Skilled Fighters rolled a 5 against their Transport (hit ≤8), followed by 1,1,4,5 against their bases (4 hits ≤7), easily destroying one, while reducing another to 2 HP
  15. Since their bases are all alone, our flagship simply rolls a 5 (miss >4)
  16. Our 3 Cruisers rolled 2,4,9 (2 hits ≤5), finishing off the very last orbital defender!

  17. Bombardment Round: At long last, Chulak is exposed to our bombardment! Our 6 Fighters rolled 1,3,3,4,6,7 (5 hits ≤6), utterly pulverizing their homeworld!

stages.heading: Stardate 2418.0 (Conclusion)
stages.commentary:
With Chulak having been glassed, that leaves us with no Alien Players left. This was certainly the most suspenseful, but also the most successful, Alien Empires playthrough we have yet recorded.

Conquering Hard difficulty for the first time was, well, hard. We have previously done playthroughs where Alien Players got 10 CP each economic roll, but it usually proved to be too much. Worse is that we are only half way done with completion of non-VP Alien Empires; there is a Harder difficulty where we have to put up with 3 Alien Players at 10 CP per economic roll; never mind two even tougher difficulties where 2-3 alien players can generate 15 CP per roll! While VP variants only allow a fixed 2 alien players, harder difficulties still give them more CP per roll and reduce the VP quota for their team.

Truly though, one of the reasons we even made it as far as we did was because the alien players never bought Movement technology. Either their rolls kept missing, or they did not have the tech CP at the time of fleet launch, or their homeworld was being beseiged. Then again, part of the charm of Alien Empires as a whole; with the random factor that vastly affects each alien player, it makes each playthrough different than the one before it. So far, we have still seen no Cloaking tech and, therefore, no raider fleets.

Most recently, we have received word from the official Space Empires 4X newsletter that All Good Things and reprints will be unleashed fairly soon, with an estimated goal of early July. What a fitting opportunity to ease up a bit, maybe take a breather; and see what is in store.

{techTable}
